summary: This document is a response from Capital One Bank to a subpoena issued by the Federal Bureau of Investigation. It outlines the bank's objections to the subpoena, details the limitations of the information they can provide, and certifies the authenticity of the business records they are submitting in response to the subpoena.

persons.name: AUSA
persons.context: AUSA is mentioned in relation to the Grand Jury subpoena issued in the matter referenced in the document.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: A Grand Jury subpoena was issued by the Assistant United States Attorney in relation to the case.

keyFacts: Capital One objects to the subpoena on several grounds, including incorrect legal entity and undue burden.
The document states that Capital One has a 7-year retention policy for account records.
No application, signature card, or identification was located for an account opened online.
The response includes a declaration certifying the authenticity of the business records provided.
The document indicates that Capital One is voluntarily providing records to the government.
